Comparison of budget allocations: The expert compared the proposed budget for public education by Gov. McDonnell with the current budget to determine if there was a decrease or increase in funding.
Analysis of budget components: The expert examined the specific components of the budget, such as the allocation for state pensions, to understand how much of the proposed increase was actually intended for education.
Evaluation of statements from politician: The expert considered the statements made by Sen. Donald McEachin, who claimed that the governor was cutting education funding. They assessed whether the claim was supported by the budget numbers and if there was any evidence to back it up.
Consultation with officials: The expert spoke to officials from the Virginia Senate Democratic Caucus to gather additional information and clarify any discrepancies or misleading aspects of the budget numbers.
